"if you're white, in America
That's the problem, Americans are so inside their own asshole that they forget there is a world out there that works differently. They truly believe that white people are privileged everywhere even in countries with 100% white people. middleman industry
We need to use that term more, there is so many middleman industries today that are ruining the fan and money, for the creators and consumers.
Seems like book publishers are one of those dinosaurs that we do not need anymore.

Actually when you have a lot of reading to do, its not so 1st world problem.
Digital real helped me out, otherwise I would have fucked up my neck, my back, my eyes and would have gone through a lot of unpleasantness.

I really don't give a shit if physical print dies, I am not sentimental to paper. May I just add, that I cannot stand the people that say they "need the feeling of paper between hands etc", mankind existed before paper and it can exist after, your eyes can absorb information perfectly well of a digital print too. Stop making book reading look like some deep ancestral, sensual experience like its sex. Just get some books on your phone and start reading them, its what you read what matters not what you hold while reading it.
Now , what does worry me, is if we start over relying on digital, as in it will be very dangerous if something happens to our electronics, and I don't mean world disaster, even just on local level. After all, I if a power outage happens, I can light on a candle and read/write, but not with my device, because it has a very short battery life.
So it feels more comfortable if we have both ways of preserving knowledge, rather then one.

WRITING.TEXT:
The solution for this problem apparently is going into settings.ini file and switching your DirectX from auto to 9. But! WRITING.TITLE: How careful one has to really be when it comes to lenses coming into contact with fluids?
WRITING.TEXT:
When I got my lenses from my doc, I was told to not shower, wash my face or swim with the lenses. Logic being that my eyes cannot clean themselves with lenses inside.
But my question is now, at which point is one to careful? There are many ways minute amounts of fluids, most likely water can enter your eye (or at least I think they do).
I mean do I really have to take my lenses out and clean them eyes with the lens solutions, every time:
I wash dishes, sit in a summer cafe with sprinklers, workout (sweat goes down into my eyes), when I drink something, when its raining etc...
Its fucking sad and pathetic that people will downvote you for offering a discussion and a nuanced opinion based on arguably good evidence.
